intro: Linanthus rattanii, commonly known as the rattan larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the tribe Linieae within the family Polemoniaceae. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as slopes and meadows. It produces showy, spurred flowers that are usually blue or purple in color. Its botanical features include opposite, lance-shaped leaves and a branching structure that supports its delicate, erect growth habit.
